alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 2:38PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RAIN AND RISING FREEZING LEVELS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... After a 2 day break, a warm front will cause precipitation to track back into the region from south to north on Friday. A wind shift to the south at all levels will allow warming temperatures through the northern inner channels Friday into Saturday. Meanwhile, snow/freezing levels will steadily rise. By Saturday morning freezing levels over the City of Haines will likely have risen to around 2,000 feet, while the Juneau area will have risen to nearly 3,000 feet. During Sunday, these values top out at over 3,000 feet for Haines and over 4,000 feet for Juneau and surrounding areas. Rainfall totals over this 3 day period are likely to exceed 2 inches across all of SE Alaska and may exceed 4 inches in Juneau. Rainfall will come in surges with heaviest rates currently expected on Sunday. Rain on significant snowpack currently in place can result in several impacts: * Snow will become heavier as it absorbs the rain, making it more difficult to move. * Heavier snow may affect susceptible properties and vessels. * Drainage blocked by snow will cause rainfall runoff and snowmelt onto streets and ponding. * Rain on hard-pack snow will become icy. * Snowmelt from high elevation snow will add to runoff. Please consider your personal property and neighborhood drainage before the onset of heavy rain. Stay tuned to updates from the National Weather Service on this developing pattern change.
